section: 13. Each Member will be responsible for its respective duties as follows: Page 3 of 13 Member Duties Description BorrowMoney.com, inc *HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements including a database for medical dispatch personal & product service as needed, including activity information, data storage and backup. provided by three qualified assigned Borrowmoney.com, inc. employees/personal JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: The description of BorrowMoney.com, inc's duties includes '*HTML code...', which is structurally flawed and doesn't fit within the context of a legal document. Furthermore, the term 'medical dispatch personal' is ambiguous. This section mixes technical jargon with vague language, making the exact obligations unclear.

section: 13. Each Member will be responsible for its respective duties as follows: Page 3 of 13 Member Duties Description BorrowMoney.com, inc *HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements including a database for medical dispatch personal & product service as needed, including activity information, data storage and backup. provided by three qualified assigned Borrowmoney.com, inc. employees/personal JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: The duties assigned to JVLS, LLC include paying '$60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.' It is unclear whether the 10% revenue is separate from the $60,000 or if that is included. Also the duties of JVLS is a financial payment. This could be considered capital contribution which makes another section contradict.

section: 15. Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: This section values BorrowMoney.com, Inc.'s contribution of 1,500 square feet of leased office space at $3,500,000.00 USD. This valuation seems extremely high for leased office space, raising concerns about the reasonableness and accuracy of the valuation. It could be perceived as an attempt to inflate the capital contribution of one member disproportionately. It's unclear if the 'specified description of duty*' is also included in the valuation.

section: 15. Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: This section values JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go’s contributions at '$60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Addition to The Total Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD'. The description indicates that the total is $3,500,000.00 USD, which directly contradicts the specified cash contribution of $60,000.00 plus a percentage of gross revenue. This is an inconsistency in value.

section: 39. In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined based on the total revenue generated over the last 3 months. An appraiser will be appointed within a reasonable period of the date of withdrawal or dissolution. The results of the appraisal will be binding on all Members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be based on the proportion of their respective capital account less any outstanding liabilities a Member may have to the Venture. The intent of this section is to ensure the survival of the Venture despite the withdrawal of any individual Member.
explanation: The first sentence states the value of the venture will be based on the last 3 months, but the third sentence states the value of a withdrawing member will be based on the capital account. This causes confusion on what the actual valuation is based on.

section: 39. In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined based on the total revenue generated over the last 3 months. An appraiser will be appointed within a reasonable period of the date of withdrawal or dissolution. The results of the appraisal will be binding on all Members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be based on the proportion of their respective capital account less any outstanding liabilities a Member may have to the Venture. The intent of this section is to ensure the survival of the Venture despite the withdrawal of any individual Member.
explanation: While this is intended to ensure the survival of the venture the capital account might be significantly different from the actual revenue from the last 3 months. Also, there is no mention of who pays the appraiser, the venture or the withdrawing member.
